segment.source: Submit an update
segment.target: Submit an update

segment.source: Submit an update
segment.target: Submit an update

segment.source: Submit an update
segment.target: Submit an update

segment.source: Updates are created by finding the difference between the current firmware and the firmware to update to, and creating an update bundle that includes those differences.
segment.target: Updates are created by finding the difference between the current firmware and the firmware to update to, and creating an update bundle that includes those differences.

segment.source: These differences are calculated, created, and hosted on Microsoft’s update servers.
segment.target: These differences are calculated, created, and hosted on Microsoft’s update servers.

segment.source: Beginning with the release of Windows 10, OEMs can no longer submit OS-only updates for retail devices by using the New-RequestForMicrosoftUpdate cmdlet.
segment.target: Beginning with the release of Windows 10, OEMs can no longer submit OS-only updates for retail devices by using the New-RequestForMicrosoftUpdate cmdlet.

segment.source: OS-only updates for retail devices will be provided by Microsoft on Windows Update.
segment.target: OS-only updates for retail devices will be provided by Microsoft on Windows Update.

segment.source: OEMs can continue to submit OS-only updates for Trial and PartnerSelfHost preview environments.
segment.target: OEMs can continue to submit OS-only updates for Trial and PartnerSelfHost preview environments.

segment.source: Submit an OEM update
segment.target: Submit an OEM update

segment.source: Get the source firmware submission ticket ID from the last time you updated this package.
segment.target: Get the source firmware submission ticket ID from the last time you updated this package.

segment.source: Get a target firmware submission ticket ID: update the binaries in the package, and submit the binaries to be retail signed to receive a new ticket ID.
segment.target: Get a target firmware submission ticket ID: update the binaries in the package, and submit the binaries to be retail signed to receive a new ticket ID.

segment.source: With both the old and new ticket IDs, submit the update request using the New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet:
segment.target: With both the old and new ticket IDs, submit the update request using the New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet:

segment.source: The output from this command gives you a request for update (RFU) ID.
segment.target: The output from this command gives you a request for update (RFU) ID.

segment.source: Use the RFU ID to check the status using the Get-RequestForUpdate cmdlet:
segment.target: Use the RFU ID to check the status using the Get-RequestForUpdate cmdlet:

segment.source: If everything looks OK, we’ll approve the request, and send it on to the Microsoft Preview test server.
segment.target: If everything looks OK, we’ll approve the request, and send it on to the Microsoft Preview test server.

segment.source: You and your mobile operator partner can test the update over the network.
segment.target: You and your mobile operator partner can test the update over the network.

segment.source: You and your mobile operator partner approve the update.
segment.target: You and your mobile operator partner approve the update.

segment.source: We’ll publish the update on the Microsoft Update production server, where the device can scan, download, and install the update.
segment.target: We’ll publish the update on the Microsoft Update production server, where the device can scan, download, and install the update.

segment.source: The following diagram shows this procedure:
segment.target: The following diagram shows this procedure:

segment.source: diagram shows update submission process
segment.target: diagram shows update submission process

segment.source: Note You cannot change OS optional features in the OEMInput.xml file between updates.
segment.target: Note You cannot change OS optional features in the OEMInput.xml file between updates.

segment.source: If a feature is changed, the update will be rejected by the publishing system.
segment.target: If a feature is changed, the update will be rejected by the publishing system.

segment.source: Submit Microsoft updates
segment.target: Submit Microsoft updates

segment.source: Use the New-RequestForMicrosoftUpdate cmdlet, using the old and new version numbers, the type of the update (RetailServicing or Trial), and the OEM device name and Mobile Operator ID:
segment.target: Use the New-RequestForMicrosoftUpdate cmdlet, using the old and new version numbers, the type of the update (RetailServicing or Trial), and the OEM device name and Mobile Operator ID:

segment.source: With the ticket IDs for both the existing firmware and the new firmware, submit an update request using the New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet.
segment.target: With the ticket IDs for both the existing firmware and the new firmware, submit an update request using the New-RequestForUpdate cmdlet.

segment.source: The update is published to Microsoft’s production update server, where the device can scan, download, and install the update.
segment.target: The update is published to Microsoft’s production update server, where the device can scan, download, and install the update.
